revised_title: A Defense of the Distinction Between the Carolina Pennated Toxicodendron and the Japan Varnish-Tree
tldr: The author argues against the notion that the Carolina pennated Toxicodendron and the Japan varnish-tree are the same plant, providing evidence from their growth patterns, leaf and flower structures, and fruit shapes. He also critiques the reliance on leaf similarity as the sole basis for classification.
